title: In Contrast
writeup: In contrast to my previous portfolio, which felt busy and noisy, my goal with this iteration was to embrace minimalism while still incorporating some flair. I opted for a two-toned, high-contrast color palette accented by splashes of color and subtle movement. My intention was to present myself and highlight my skill set without overwhelming visitors with too many distractions.

Each section is designed around a message and utilizes an animating element, a color-applied element, and a highlight font. Although these elements are not mutually exclusive, the color emphasizes the focus of a section, while the animations and font enhance the message conveyed by that focal point. For example, the red heart symbolizes my love for development, and the font accentuates the action in the animating statements. Vertical lines between sections break up white space, making each scroll meaningful. Finally, a white noise overlay softens the high contrast and breathes life into the site.

title: Coding Kombat Quiz
writeup: Coding Kombat Quiz is one of my earliest creations, and despite its age, it remains a cherished project. The initial goal was straightforward: develop a timed quiz app. However, I wanted to take it a step further by gamifying the experience. My vision was an interface inspired by retro arcade machines and fighting games. Players would select a character and face increasingly challenging question sets, each represented by enemy characters. Correct answers would trigger attacks, while too many wrong choices or running out of time would result in defeat.

While my ambition outpaced my early web development skills, especially given the one-week deadline, I was fortunate to have prior experience with 2D sprite sheets, animations, and basic game loops. The challenge was integrating these elements into a cohesive application.

Though I couldn’t implement all the game features I envisioned, the final product still captures the essence of my original idea. The quiz generator is designed for easy expansion, allowing for the inclusion of more difficult question banks. The main game loop, while functional, is set up for future refactoring to support multiple matches. Character selection is also ready for additional fighters, though the animation controllers will need adjustments to accommodate character-specific moves.

title: Weather Ornought
writeup: This project is one of my earliest builds but it still holds a special place in my heart. The original goal - create a timed quiz app. I thought that creating the quiz functionality would be easy enough that I would attempt to gamify the quiz. I envisioned an interface that resembled a retro arcade machine and a fighting game. Players would choose they're character and progress through tougher questions represented by additional enemy characters. Characters perform attacks based on selected answers and too many incorrect selections or if time runs out then the game ends.

I understood that my reimagination of the quiz app was out of my reach given my lack of experience in web development at that point and a one week time constraint. Fortunately, I was already familiar with 2D sprite sheets, animating, and basic game loops.
